meanings.definition: To ask questions of (a person), sometimes to seek answers or information that the person questioned considers personal or secret.
meanings.sent1: The detective decided to interrogate the suspect to find out more about the crime.
meanings.sent2: The police officer will interrogate the witness to gather more details about the incident.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat tried to interrogate the closed door, wondering what was behind it.
meanings.sent4: The journalist's probing questions interrogated the politician's true intentions.
meanings.sent5: The bright spotlight in the interrogation room made the suspect feel uneasy.

meanings.definition: To examine by questioning formally or officially.
meanings.sent1: During the trial, the lawyer will interrogate the witness to uncover the truth.
meanings.sent2: The committee will interrogate the candidate to assess their qualifications for the job.
meanings.sent3: The teacher playfully interrogated the students about their favorite school subjects.
meanings.sent4: The scientist's experiments interrogated the validity of the existing theory.
meanings.sent5: The intense cross-examination interrogated the defendant's alibi.
